content:
Yes, North Rhine-Westphalia has several vocational schools that offer programs in robotics. Here are some examples:

1. Berufskolleg für Technik (BfT) in Siegen: The school offers a program in mechatronics, which covers robotics, as well as electronics and mechanical engineering. The program provides hands-on training with industrial robots and automation systems.

2. Robert-Bosch-Berufskolleg in Dortmund: The school offers a program in automation technology, which includes courses in robotics and control systems. The program also provides training in PLC (programmable logic controllers) programming and other skills needed in industrial automation.

3. Friedrich-List-Berufskolleg in Düsseldorf: The school offers a program in mechanical engineering, which includes robotics and automation as integral parts of the curriculum. The program provides training in both the programming and operation of industrial robots.

4. Berufskolleg des Kreises Heinsberg in Geilenkirchen: The school offers a program in mechatronics, which includes courses in robotics, automation, and programmable logic controllers. The program also provides training in CAD (computer-aided design) and CNC (computer numerical control) systems.

These are just a few examples of the vocational schools in North Rhine-Westphalia that offer programs in robotics. It's worth checking with individual schools to find out more about their programs and eligibility requirements.
